title: Can you decide wether J4 is a diver or a oneshot bot?
body:
I mean when i first found out about J4 he was this big muthafucka that engaged and locked down people. And he had enough dmg on his own to do like 70% of squishy health. 

Right now i just see J4's ( when we actually see em lawl ) build a warrior and a lethality item and instantly oneshot everything that isnt't a full armor tank.

His tank build aint even toxic unlike other champs cause his actual cc is hard to land on a competent player. His full ad builds are toxic and they oneshot harder than a Rengar consistently. 
Yet everytime i see a J4 change is a nerf to his utility or defences. Nobody likes oneshot bot J4 yet you keep pushing him to that full ad build. You could litterally tone down his bases and scaling and improve his shield and make him a glorious iniciator again that locks people down away from his team or for his team to wombo.

The problem is you can't always outplay the first rotation. There's not much you can do to outplay J4 as a squishy.

If you can't kill them for most of the game, but they're not some massive damage threat you need to take out, you can actually just sit and...farm. Or play the vision game. Or manipulate the wave. When dead, the only thing you can do is drop Redemption.

Maybe I'm insane, but I don't see the problem with this.

J4 is noticeably ahead, building pure tank, and fighting multiple strings of weakened enemies 1 by 1. Pretty much any beefy / tanky champ could have done the same stuff, though j4 is EXTREMELY sticky, which means most of them wouldn't have been able to pursue Nami past the bubble.

Either way, no one dies quickly to him, and there's plenty of idiocy / misplays which lead him to get all those kills.
Doesn't matter if you die when you go 2 for 1 by diving their back line and killing the ADC and support next to each other since all your damage is AoE.
You {{champion:40}} can {{champion:117}} easily {{champion:412}} counter {{champion:12}} Jarvan {{champion:223}} diving {{champion:78}} your {{item:3190}} backline.

Of those, only Poppy and Janna are actually doing anything in time.

Poppy with her W, Janna with her R. The others won't be able to react fast enough to protect the squishies.

Janna can cancel J4's EQ with her Q. Lulu can ult the ADC and polymorph J4 after EQ. Thresh's flay cancels J4 EQ. Ali can headbutt J4 after EQ. Tahm can just eat the ADC. Locket will mitigate a decent portion of J4 burst.

And most of those take too much time, or require you to be on top of the ADC/J4 already for it.

These just aren't accessible for the average player.

All of these supports should be on top of the ADC to begin with, the only way J4 has around this is by having superior vision control, which can easily go both ways. 

Supports that are Silver or higher should be expected to be able to react to their ADC being dived, if they aren't able to, they belong in Bronze, and League should not be balanced around Bronze level gameplay. 

If you don't have a support like these, you probably have someone like {{champion:63}}{{champion:99}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:143}}  as your support, which is entirely fair, since they traded ADC protection for damage.

Janna Q isnt fast enough top stop J4 combo, unless she already sees it coming from a mile away. She has to R, but if she Rs the EQ, he can just press R himself, and then it comes down to who stat checks the hardest, but J4 usually wins because his R kinda does a metric fuck ton of damage when he's  full AD.

They have effectively gutted this Bruisers ability to tank... so he does what all Bruisers do when they do that to them. He abuses the hell out of his damage potential, which he only has because most of his itemization was meant to be tanky.

Bases should stay high, crush the scaling though (especially on his ultimate). 

Then open room to buff his shield or give back armor on his E, or otherwise increase his defenses.

I've always enjoyed bruiser/tank J4 over assassin J4. However pro play typically sees him played full tank, abusing his early base damage to get early ganks, then scaling into a full tank threat. That's probably why his nerfs push him towards full AD. 

I couldn't imagine playing J4 without threatening damage on my EQ though. He needs threatening engage damage or else he's useless top Lane, and not a strong jungler.
J4 is actually pretty balanced right now in my opinion, strong early and pretty weak late if you ask me

What if:

Q
Base DMG 80 + 40 per rank > 80 + 60 per rank
Scaling 120% bonus AD > 60% bonus AD
Can apply Martial Cadence

W
Base Shield 60 + 15 per rank > 50% total Armor + 50% total MR
Gain 2% + .25% bonus HP as shield > 3% at all ranks

R
Scaling 150% bonus AD > 80% bonus AD + 10% bonus HP

I just like to throw around numbers I'm not too good at them, but I feel as though this would help the J4 situation. This should make it so that full damage is only strong early on and bruiser/tank scales really nicely into mid/late. I didn't take armor/lethality into consideration because I'm too lazy for that.

The changes to Q make it so that even with less AD you'll still do near the same damage as someone who's building full AD.

The W changes reward you the tankier you are. Everything should be relatively the same with a bruiser based build. It only starts to be much stronger than the flat shield value when you get extremely tanky.

The R changes curve damage. You will do more damage as a bruiser/tank than you would with pure damage.

You guys DO realize his lethality build is solo queue cheese at best, right? Lethality builds *are supposed to spike early, then drop off.* What you're experiencing is J4 opting into early game spikes, but if he doesn't sell all that and re-itemize late game, he'll be entirely useless.

With all the wall-jumping mobility in the game, he doesn't have much else going for him. His ult hasn't aged well and his knock-up is hard to land. You're almost better off building tank Camille than tank Jarvin, just because targets can get out of her box.

Jarvan's pull can knock *multiple* people up on a basic ability. That's extremely powerful in and of itself.

Jarvan's ult actually damages people. Camille's doesn't.

Jarvan's kit ultimately makes him a diver that's slightly reminiscent of a vanguard champion, while Camille's much better with a standard diver build, with standard diver items. Jarvan's kit is "pretty solid" atm, with emphasis being on his flag-n-drag rather than his ult. It holds up enough, anyway.
